title: A Randomized Open-Label, Active-Controlled Multi-Center Study of MEL-802 (checkpoint inhibitor) in Patients With HIV Infection
officialTitle: A Randomized Open-Label, Active-Controlled Multi-Center Study of MEL-802 (checkpoint inhibitor) in Patients With HIV Infection
description: This is a randomized open-label, active-controlled multi-center study designed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of MEL-802 (checkpoint inhibitor) in patients with HIV Infection. The study will enroll approximately 109 patients.
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults aged 22-81 years
- Confirmed diagnosis of HIV Infection
- ECOG performance status 0-1
- Adequate organ function
- Willing and able to provide informed consent

Exclusion Criteria:
- Known hypersensitivity to study drug or excipients
- Pregnant or breastfeeding women
- Participation in another interventional study within 30 days
- Significant cardiovascular disease within past 6 months
- Active or chronic infection requiring systemic treatment
